Hypothesis testing (A/B Testing)
1
Analyzed the impact of direct mail campaign on response rate for various 
segments. Used hypothesis testing to test the response rate for
• Customers who were shared mailer
• Customers who were not shared mailer
• Identified the target profile based on test results to maximize the response rate
Boating and fishing supplies retailer

© 2024 Accordion     CONFIDENTIAL
© 2024 Accordion     CONFIDENTIAL
Picture this…
You’re looking to identify customer segments where the campaign has been effective and the types of mailers that are 
impactful by leveraging statistical A/B testing evaluation techniques. You have been running a monthly direct mailer campaign 
for multiple years but lacked visibility into the impact of the program across customer segments. 
Boating and fishing supplies retailer needs hypothesis testing 
(A/B testing)
2
Your value is enhanced. 
•
Recommended continued budget allocation to a targeted mailer program given the revenue impact and estimated ROI
•
Identified the target profile for the direct mailer program having highest impact on response rate (100+ bps)
•
Identified breakeven points for future mailer campaigns based on expected revenue impact of incremental response rates from 
customers (~0.3%) 
•
Identified the flyer characteristics and time period of deployment that has the highest probability of impact
HYPOTHESIS TESTING (A/B TESTING)
KEY RESULT   
•
Highest impact on 
response rate (100+ 
bps)
•
Impact of incremental 
response rates from 
customers (~0.3%) 
VALUE LEVERS PULLED
•
Hypothesis testing
•
A/B testing
2
You turn to Accordion. 
We partner with your team to analyze the impact of direct mail campaign on response rate for various segments. Used 
hypothesis testing to test the response rate for
•
Customers who were shared mailer
•
Customers who were not shared mailer
Identifying the target profile based on test results to maximize the response rate, including:
1) Analyzing the performance of the direct mailer program for each customer segment (such as geography, age, channel 
etc.) by evaluating the statistical lift of the test group beyond the control group using hypothesis testing techniques
2) Enabling the marketing team to identify the mailer list for upcoming months based on the customers segments where 
Direct mailer campaigns had a significant impact on response rates in the past
3) Comparing each segment for incrementality based on statistical significance observed using 1 tailed t-test

© 2024 Accordion     CONFIDENTIAL
© 2024 Accordion     CONFIDENTIAL
Accordion Value Add 
•
Analyzed the performance of the direct mailer program for each customer segment (such as geography, age, channel etc.) by evaluating the statistical lift of 
the test group beyond the control group using hypothesis testing techniques
•
Enabled the marketing team to identify the mailer list for upcoming months based on the customers segments where Direct mailer campaigns had a 
significant impact on response rates in the past
•
Compared each segment for incrementality based on statistical significance observed using 1 tailed t-test
Situation
•
Client had been running a monthly Direct Mailer campaign for multiple years but lacked visibility into the impact of the program across customer segments
•
Partnered with the client to identify customer segments where the campaign has been effective and the types of mailers that are impactful by leveraging 
statistical A/B testing evaluation techniques
Hypothesis testing for boating and fishing supplies retailer
3
Impact
•
Recommended continued budget allocation to a targeted mailer program given the revenue impact and estimated ROI
•
Identified the target profile for the direct mailer program having highest impact on response rate (100+ bps)
•
Identified breakeven points for future mailer campaigns based on expected revenue impact of incremental response rates from customers (~0.3%) 
•
Identified the flyer characteristics and time period of deployment that has the highest probability of impact
Hypothesis Testing (A/B Testing)

© 2024 Accordion     CONFIDENTIAL
© 2024 Accordion     CONFIDENTIAL
Approach & Methodology
4
Identified different segments such as Geography, channel etc. and compared 
the impact of direct mail on response rate for each segment
Checked if the test was unbiased for each segment using distribution of 
customers between test and control segments
Used 1 tailed t-test given we wanted to check if the direct mailer has 
performed better and compare mean of two groups only in one direction
Analysis Approach
Null and alternate hypothesis were identified for the one tailed test and 
significance level of 85% was taken (P value <0.15)
Checked if the null hypothesis is true or not based on significance and P 
value. Compare incrementality between different segments to observe which 
segment will provide highest incrementality
Identified the target profile based on the incrementality results (where 
significant results are observed)
ILLUSTRATIVE

© 2024 Accordion     CONFIDENTIAL
© 2024 Accordion     CONFIDENTIAL

5
Response rate and revenue for Mailer (Test) and 
Control group for a segment
p-Value results based on one tailed T 
test and incrementality
Null Hypothesis: Response rate for Direct Mailer is less than or equal to response rate for Control
Alternate hypothesis: Response rate for Direct Mailer is greater than response rate for Control

Region 5 performed high

flyers.
Therefore, the campaign has

7
1) Expanded the knowledge in Hypothesis testing using one tailed and two 
tailed test.
2) Explored which analysis to be used to compare incrementality between 
test and control across two different segments.
3) P value and Significance calculation using Excel and the in-house tool. 
Fixed a few errors in the tool as well.
4) Selection of relevant hypothesis test to be used based on data and 
business context and creating null and alternate hypothesis.
Learnings
